1.content:
Lara King awoke with a start, before choking and spluttering as she coughed up some seawater. The 23 year-old lifeguard looked around her new surroundings in astonishment. She was in a small cave, with a pool of twinkling water the only exit. There was a natural blue light illuminating the cave, and, as Lara slowly tried to get to her feet, she realised there was no way the light could be getting in. Her legs felt weak, and she sat back down, struggling to remember how she got here.

Of course. She'd gone out to help save the passengers on a small yacht that had run aground. With the ship on fire, she'd been dropped onto the deck from the coastguard helicopter, and had helped the passengers into the escape unit and to safety. And then...

The yacht had exploded. Lara remembered losing her balance and hitting her head on something, and then a second explosion which blown her into the water...

None of which explained how on Earth she had ended up here. Wherever here was.

"Unless I'm...dead..." she thought out loud.

She put her hand to her head, to where she expecting to find blood, or a bruise, or anything from where she'd hit it. There was nothing. No marks, no pain.

"This is...too weird..." Her swimsuit had a few tears and burn marks, but she knew it could have been much worse.

She stared into the water, marvelling out how clear it was. She could see almost to where she assumed there was a bottom, and another tunnel leading off from that. As she gazed into it, a creature swam out from the tunnel, and up towards her.

A girl, she thought.

With a tail.

...Mermaid...?!?!

Lara moved back from the edge of the pool as the figure broke the surface, facing away from her. She shook her long dark hair, and began to place some shiny rocks and crystals on the bank. Lara's heart skipped a beat as the girl began to sing. The song wasn't in a language Lara could understand, but it was the most beautiful thing she'd ever heard. The girl fussed over the rocks as if organising them, and then Lara moved slightly, dislodging a stone which plopped into the water. The girl turned to Lara, and beamed.

"Oh, you're awake! Oh, wonderful! Are you alright?"

The girl swam over to Lara, who was amazed at the beauty of this creature. From her face, she guessed she was barely 20, with a natural look of wide-eyed innocence, and rather large breasts. She rested her hands on the bank and looked up at Lara, still smiling.

"I'm sorry, you must be so scared. I promise, there's nothing to be scared of. My name is Carin."

"I...I must be dreaming...you're a...mermaid?"

Carin giggled. "Yes. And you're not dreaming. Take my hand."

When Lara didn't, Carin smiled even wider. "Or at least tell me your name?"

"What...oh. Sorry...I'm Lara..." She slowly took Carin's hand in hers, and felt the girl's warm wet hand. She was real. She wasn't dreaming.

"Lara...that's beautiful."

"Where am I?" she asked.

"My home." explained Carin. "Well, not my birth home, but this is where I come when I want to be alone. I can spend days here...there are some very pretty rocks around here, I collect them."

"I'm sorry, I...how did I get here?"

"Oh, well, I like to watch you. Not just you, all the humans that play in the water. I know it's a bit dangerous really, but I keep my distance. I've actually been longing to meet one of you - in fact, I hoped it would be you."

"Why me?"

"You look like a human, yet you swim like a fish. Movement in the water seems to come as naturally to you as it does to me. And you help people. You are strong and beautiful. I like you."

Lara blushed. "Thank you..."

"That's alright. Anyway, I was watching you help those people when their ship hit the rocks. You didn't escape, you were thrown into the water. You come to help anyone, but no-one came to help you. At least, not in time. I couldn't let you die. I brought you here."

"Oh...you've saved me. Oh, thank you, so much..."

Carin giggled. "That's alright."

The two women looked at each other in silence for a while, then Carin asked "How do you feel now?"

"Oh, much better...I'm sorry, this is just so weird..."

"I know." said Carin. "But, it's good weird, isn't it?"

Lara smiled. "It is. I didn't think mermaids were real..."

"Well...it's lucky for you we are, isn't it?"

"Yes...Carin...I don't want to seem rude, but...what happens now?"

"I have to take you home. It would be pretty difficult for a human alone to swim through this tunnel. The mermaid pointed at the tunnel and Lara could tell she was serious. Carin jumps in. "This cave is underground so once we get out of here, you'll be able to find your way back home easy".

Within a second, the mermaid dived under and a single kick from her powerful tail was all she needed to fight the current. She was so fast and Carin moved around with such grace, she was narrowly avoiding rocks. You cannot believe she exists but if it wasn't for her, you would be dead. You broke through and sunlight almost blinded you. You gasp for air and turn towards your new friend.

"You are...unbelievable Carin"

Carin, who was a bit wary of coming on land hesitated at first but once she saw the desperate look on Lara's face, she changed her mind.

"Well...alright we will meet tomorrow night" She pointed at the large clock tower at a distance "When the 2 hands point the highest, I will be at this beach hiding behind the rocks over there near the water. Make sure you're alone okay"

Lara nodded and gave Carin one last thank you and they hugged each other farewell. Then the mermaid quickly dived back into the ocean, within seconds Carin was out of sight. Lara looked over at the public beach and swam towards the shore. It wasn't long before she recognised one of her male coworkers and she was immediately taken to a hospital to be checked over.

That evening, the test results came out negative and with some clothes bought for her from her coworker, she was changed and was ready to come home. Nobody, not even Lara could believe Lara was back with no cuts or bruises but Lara made sure she would not hint the existence of mermaids. She lied and said she woke up on a beach close to where the boat exploded and she swam back home which was a more believable story. Carin is her new important friend that she needed to keep secret.

When Lara's friend left her home alone, Lara wanted nothing more than to rest for the evening and go to sleep but there was something strange that had been bothering her since the ride home. She could swear there were a multitude of spikes catching themselves on the thigh portion on her jeans and she was desperate to investigate. Lara stood by the bedroom mirror and immediately rolled the jeans down. What she saw there was not hair or a sticky substance that she expected. Instead, the majority of the skin on her left thigh had transformed somehow and looked a lot like scales. Lara gasped and slowly bought her hand across the blue mass. It was the scariest thing she had seen because it was similar too... "C...Carin!" She cried after recognising the scale pattern. She lay on the bed and painfully pulled a scale off, there she examined the fish scale. Whatever was happening to her was not normal.

Lara panicked and fumbled around the bathroom to put her jeans back on which was proving to be difficult as the scales were catching on the material. Sandra, Lara's mother was walking up the stairs, turning on all the lights as she travelled. "Ahh Mom, I'm here. I'll be out in a second!" With that, Sandra goes into Lara's room waiting for her.

Lara puts off her mermaid issue for now. When she managed to put herself back in the jeans, she went out the room and came back to greet her mother. Sandra was in tears, the thought of losing her little girl was too much for her "I'm just so glad you're alright sweetheart" Sandra rushed over to Lara and hugged her tight. Her giant breasts almost crushing her daughter. "Where were you? And how did you get home?" Sandra was obviously oblivious of the whole story, and had probably only just been told Lara was safe.

Again, Lara retold her story to her mother similarly to what she told her coworker. Sandra paid attention throughout, shocked at what her daughter had gone through. Lara was about to finish when she felt a strange tingling sensation around her waist.

13.content:
"Actually, you have to try on this crown," replied the mermaid, handing Lara a beautiful crown, made of fabulous sea-stones. Lara coudn't see where she had picked it up from. It appeared to come out of thin air. Or thin water, as the case may be.

"Try on the crown?"

"Yes, our texts say our Queen would come from a fireball, and be the only one who could wear this crown without it hurting her. You must try it out."

"I'm sorry, I have my job and my family to go back to. I can't be Queen here."

"Now that you're here, and you came from a fireball, you have to try it out."

Reluctantly, Lara took the crown and put it on her head. It didn't hurt at all.

Suddenly, they were surrounded by beautiful designs - if they hadn't been in the water, Lara would have thought these were fireworks. The sparkles wizzed by, creating lovely colours and shapes in the water. As Lara marvelled, she heard the sound of rejoicing.

"Our Queen! Our great Queen of the Fireball! She is here at last!"

The walls of the cave dissolved, to reveal hundreds of merpeople of all ages, from babies to the elderly, cheering and shouting, holding banners with Lara's picture on them. Lara - wearing a crown - and - as a MERMAID!

As she looked down at herself, Lara saw that she had grown a tail, and was now, indeed a mermaid.
